result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard James Whitney

defendant.name: Whitney, Richard James

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

9:15 AM Defendant Richard James Whitney in court, in custody.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Richard James Whitney.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 09:10 am.

10:52 AM Defendant Richard James Whitney in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Richard James Whitney.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reschedules.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 10:50 am.

1:55 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard James Whitney in court.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Richard James Whitney. Status rescheduled. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:50 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 01:40 pm.

3:30 PM Defendant Richard James Whitney appeared by phone.  Attorney Shannon Viel in court for Richard James Whitney.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense waives formal reading of complaint, waives time limits for prelim. Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
No contact direct or indirect with Sturgeon Bay Walmart.

1:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard James Whitney appeared by video from Door County Jail. Atty Shannon Viel appeared by video for Richard Whitney. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
